website_summaries.verdict: Thanks to its stellar performance and nifty design, the Lexar JumpDrive Triton is more than worth its relatively high price tag.
pros: The USB 3.0-based Lexar JumpDrive Triton offers top performance
The drive is compact, sturdy, great looking, and comes with excellent port design
cons: The Lexar JumpDrive Triton's capacity caps at just 64GB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Speeds!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this USB drive back in 2012 for around $120. It's almost 2019 now, and it's still the best USB drive I've owned. I finally got around to running a speed test (after all these years) and was surprised that it actually had read/write speeds that were the same! ~179/175 MB/s!!! Of course, you get what you pay for, it's not cheap by any means. The performance is amazing, and the construction is solid and sturdy. I've used this drive to transfer anything from large work folders, my movies, my library of music, for the past 6 years, and it's never let me down or failed on me.
customer_reviews.author: Russel

customer_reviews.title: Very fast - press to open or close
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this Lexar drive which I bought because of its reputation for being one of the fastest and most reliable USB 3.0 Flash drives. It performs superbly. At first though, I had a lot of trouble opening and closing the slide-out connector. On closer inspection I realized that it has a safety feature and you have to press down a little in order to push the slide. Now I know, it is easy to work. Also, it comes formatted FAT-32 and Master Boot Record partition so, if you use a Mac, I recommend using DiskUtility to erase the partition and set it up as HFS (journaled) GUID.
customer_reviews.author: Job S Tadoo

customer_reviews.title: Damn fast and very good quality
customer_reviews.text: My wife was browsing lots of memories and Amazon until she came to this one and fell in love with it. It was about 50 to 100% more expensive than the other ones but we decided to give it a go. She is extremely happy with it and its blazing fast!. We transferred a 1GB file in around 5 seconds!. If you can afford it get it!, The quality of built is very good too. Pros: - Damn Fast - Well built and elegant - Excellent packaging Cons: - Costly - Slider to hide the connector could be better
customer_reviews.author: will824

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive is the fastest I've ever used. The benchmark tests provided by others helped me decide to purchase this one and I'm glad I did. It's price than most 3.0 flash drives, but well worth it. i bought this a few months ago, and only recently have I seen one that may be a competitor to this one, plus it's twice the capacity: Kingston Digital HyperX 3.0 DataTraveler (DTHX30/64GB)
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, fast, what else do you want?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a linux boot disk, mainly choosing USB 3.0 for the speed. I was pleasantly surprised by the sturdy metal shell that the USB retracts into; fit is snug and sturdy, though I haven't put it through much abuse yet. I wasn't impressed by the string that came with it, unless I did it wrong, it requires you to bend open a small ring and loop your USB around. There are easier and more sturdy ways, but this is a minor gripe.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Good flash drive.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this flash drive. It has so much capacity that it's really more than I need. I have found that flash drives are somewhat slow when you load them up with thousands of wordprocessing files. But this is a good flash drive, and if you have very large files, it's probably a good way to go. It works fine for me, and it has the look and feel of quality. The retractable plug on the end means you do not have to worry about losing a cap.
customer_reviews.author: The Thinker

customer_reviews.title: very fast. reliable
customer_reviews.text: bought over a year ago and it's still faster than anyone's drive in the office. real speed advantage is seen on usb3 ports. all usb3 arent equal. my motherboard was specifically chosen with fast usb3 support (chipset, bus speed etc.). but even on laptops with stock usb3 ports, this thing blazes. write speed slower than read. if u got the $$, look for the higher model with fast write and read speeds. it approx double the cost tho!
customer_reviews.author: Tariq Khan

customer_reviews.title: Very fast but a little slower at back up than I expected
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to save some time when I made backups but was not dramatically faster than my USB 2.0 drive. I called tech support and what they told me was backups will usually transfer more slowly than single files simply because there's so many different files and it takes longer to copy these individual files. I have amazing speed when copying over a large file like a video but have found that when there are multiple files it definitely slows.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Review sites say this is the fastest drive, I agree 33x faster than old drive
customer_reviews.text: Well, My family had to wait 25 minutes for a single 1080p movie to copy to my old 32gb drive so we could watch it on my 55 Panasonic TV. This one did 3 movies in 5 minutes, about 24gb of files, I searched for the fastest drive, this one came up, and it worked. I also tried it on another computer that is just usb 2.0 and it was still 10 times faster. Get one, you won't wait long any more.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M. Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely top-notch. I'm using it with a three foot USB3 extension cable from my laptop and I can drop a one gig file into it and it's no different than copying and pasting it from one spot on my desktop to the other. Seamless is a better description. A little costly, but cutting-edge comes at a price. Do your own research the write and read speed on this jump drive is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast!
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews out there i purchased one, it is the fastest USB 3.0 drive I've ever owned. I performed two tests right before i submitted this review just to give some real world results. A single 5.4GB movie file took 57 seconds to copy. 5.6GB of mixed files and sizes, 290 files in 15 folders, took 1minute and 42 seconds to copy. This thing just plain screams.
customer_reviews.author: LanFear

customer_reviews.title: Just as fast as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a fast way to transfer files between many computers. This is the perfect drive for that because not only does it have fast reads (like many USB 3.0 drives), it also has very fast writes. A USB drive with fast writes is a rare find. When writing large files I top out at the advertised speed: 150 MB/s, that's 1.2 gigabit/second! Reads are equally fast. It only takes a few minutes to transfer 5-10 GB files between computers.
customer_reviews.author: JoeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product - Lexar JumpDrive Triton 16GB USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product, Great quality, the back is made of alluminium and the front is a hard platic feeling pretty solid. Transfer Rate : USB 3.0 1.65 GB File - 17.4 sec at 106 mb/s USB 2.0 1.65 GB File - 63.7 sec at 27 mb/s I Recommend this USB Flash Drive to anybody that need something with fast speed !
customer_reviews.author: Fayner4

customer_reviews.title: Serves me well
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast and reliable, and seems to be holding up quite well over time. The plastic top portion (the black part) does pick up scratches, but after a while, they stop bothering you. I know I haven't yet run out of storage space on this thumb drive, which is great because I work with a lot of music and video. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ProjectJLN

customer_reviews.title: Fastest USB drive I've ever tried or seen
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 32 GB drive in June 2013. Solid build/Good Weight/Slider is solid as well... The speed is great. Ran a benchmark speed test a couple times. Read Speed Averaged 100 MB/s and Write Speed Averaged 150 MB/s The benchmark test uses a variety of file sizes but either way it's ridiculously fast. Spend the money and get the good drive it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Obsidian

customer_reviews.title: 75MB/s write speed
customer_reviews.text: I got both the Lexar Triton and the Sandisk Extreme 3.0, both 16GB version because the 32GB is a bit expensive. The speed test is as follows: Lexar Triton: 94MB/s read 75MB/s write SanDisk Extreme 3.0: 99MB/s read 60MB/s write The test file is a 1.5GB file, and both USB drives are in FAT32 format as it is shipped. A Macbook Pro Retina with 256GB SSD was used to do the speed test.
customer_reviews.author: Epsilon Delta

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: It's more expensive than most other flash drives, but it's so much faster. For a 4 or 8 GB drive, speed may not be that important, but for a large flash drive, it will take hours to read or write that much data if you go cheap. This drive is sturdy and fast...what else matters in a flash drive?
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Daniels

customer_reviews.title: ... blazingly fast & built like a tank !!!
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed & solid as a rock to the touch - it's built like a tank, & crazy, crazy fast !!! JumpDrive Triton 32GB : ATTO Bench_32 / ASMedia XHCI v.1.14.1.0 / Rear Panel USB 3.0 READ : 175 MB/s WRITE: 188 MB/s .... see ATTO pic ... JumpDrive Triton 32Gb 3.0 - Extreme Quality & Extreme Speeds - "Very Nicely Done Lexar" !!!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: awesome drive
customer_reviews.text: I won't get in too deep on this review, lots of others did. That really helped my decision to buy and it was worth it. I would recommend this drive to anyone any day. Super fast, solid, built well. I really like this drive. It is just so fast it's not funny. Easily the fastest usb drive I have ever had. I also have another usb 3 drive, and this one blows that away.
customer_reviews.author: PR7t

customer_reviews.title: Fast Fast Fast
customer_reviews.text: This drive is much faster than the ones I usually get at the office supply store. I bought it specifically to transfer some large data files. I use it on a Win 7 machine with a USB 3 port and a macbook pro 2011 model with a USB 2.0 port. Surprisingly it transfers files faster on the macbook pro. Go figure. Anyway, it is very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow, probably defective
customer_reviews.text: This drive is essentially unusable. It has a transfer speed of, often less than 1 kb/s. I assume it's defective, but I can't tell what's wrong with it. Stuff transfers to it, but it takes forever.
customer_reviews.author: Father Time

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best USB drive I have ever used. It's speeds are far faster than any of the cheaper ones I have used, Both on USB 2.0 and 3.0. The drive feels very sturdy and well made. I was considering this drive for a long time but was not wanting to pay the high price. I'm glad I did. It's worth every bit.
customer_reviews.author: TrevoR

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, with USB 2 or 3
customer_reviews.text: My main reason for buying the Triton 64 was its advertised speed, especially for transferring large numbers of small files. I've been using it for 2 months, and it is incredibly fast, even when using a USB 2 port instead of a USB 3 port. Copying hundreds of small files (typical size around 0.2 MB to 10 MB per file) is as fast or faster than it was with the portable hard disk drive I used to use. And full disk searches are much, much faster than with the portable disk drive.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction and Performance
customer_reviews.text: I get lots of free US drives in my technology role, so I'm pretty fussy about what I spend me own money on. Doing my research the Lexar JumpDrive Triton was one of the faster USB 3.0 drives out there, but what was particularly appealing to me was the elegant look and robust construction of the drive, along with the slide away USB - no cap to lose! I now have a 32Gb and 64GB Triton, and will likely get a 128Gb to use with Windows 8 To Go feature, if they upgrade the drive with official support for this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Masson

customer_reviews.title: crazy fast
customer_reviews.text: i wish i had bought this in a larger size. its definitely the fastest usb stick ive had, even though ive bought newer models since. i end up using this as my main stick for work, normally transferring 4-5 gigs at a time (folders of 2 to 50mb files), and it flies. of course, its much more expensive.... its also very heavy, due to the higher grade materials used.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kim

customer_reviews.title: This drive is amazingly fast and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure you don't lose it, since it's not the most inexpensive flash drive out there! Generally flash drives are extremely slow. This is the fastest USB flash drive I've ever had especially in a USB 3.0 port. I'm debating if I should go on continuing looking for my drive or just order another. I'm in withdrawal from the speed!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: After searching and reading the inter web I chose this one this time around. It is great and better than any I have owned. I did buy a case to protect it, because I think dust in the pocket can creep into the unit un-protected.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good USB 3.0 Stick, but pricey.
customer_reviews.text: As the title states, the Lexar USB 3.0 stick is noticeably faster than other sticks, but you pay for it. The physical quality is very good and I like the ease of flipping out the connector rather than taking off a top which you can lose. I'd purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a recovery drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to copy a factory recovery partition onto. It's bootable, works on Windows 8.1, allows me to remove the recovery partition and gain 27gb of usable space on my SSD. Came with some sort of software on it, didn't use it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Zinn

customer_reviews.title: Great flashdrive
customer_reviews.text: I love how this flash drive looks. It looks like a quality product and it feels heavy and durable. The metal on the back and the slick black plastic material make this flash drive look amazing, and the read/write speeds are one of, if not the best, that you can find on a thumb drive.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Kwak

customer_reviews.title: Failed in a year and a half, but looks nice even when not functioning  RMA in progress
customer_reviews.text: Drive failed after a year and a half. It wasn't ever used a lot, I picked it up to copy some files and when I plugged it in it was only showing 29MB of space available. I formatted it and nothing changed. The formatting tool was only showing 27MB of space on it. I am in the proces of RMAing it, we will see how that process goes. It is already irritating that I have to pay to ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: Hoppman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Its really good, quality is high and of course it's fast. The thwo things that are different from other USB flashes in my opinion are the weight (I guess it's much heavier but who cares its not that issue ) and it's a product of USA.
customer_reviews.author: Mm

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast USB stick
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a fast, big USB stick to use with my new USB 3.0 PC and paid extra for this Lexar because of the speed claims. The claims proved correct and it was worth paying extra for a high performance flash drive. I clock speeds of 75-80mbps when transferring lots of data. The device feels high quality to me and I like the way the connector retracts. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Fastest Flash Drive.
customer_reviews.text: Compared this against three other Flash drives. It was 30 to 60 percent faster. Build quality is also good. I will highly recommend this product, but if you want to use the full potential of this product, then you need USB 3.0.
customer_reviews.author: Amer Bedi

customer_reviews.title: A good solid moderate speed unit
customer_reviews.text: I love the looks of this and that it is made in the UNITED STATES! Unfortunately, it is not as fast as my SanDisk Extreme. I'm not sorry I bought it as it's a close second. For the price, it's just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: All positives
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly fast, on top of it looks great and professional, solid even rugged design, retraction connector very convenient. I picked it up mainly due to the advertised speed as I am running from it a portable Linux system. The result pleasantly surpassed my expectations. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ilja

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with speed and quality
customer_reviews.text: I have three memory sticks thus far and the Lexar surpasses the Sony as well as the third one. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AMIGO DE MEXICO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a very small thumb drive. It is 32gb and really fits my needs. I carry this in my pocket most times if i need to pull up a contract on the fly. I cant read contracts on my phone..too small.
customer_reviews.author: Gideon Gransaull

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Lighting fast in my USB 3.0 port. I didn't perform any actual benchmark tests but read and write speeds appeared at least twice as fast as the USB 2 counterparts.
customer_reviews.author: A. Westner

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Fast speed. I would recommend this flash drive to anyone. Its made in the USA for those who want to promote USA products.
customer_reviews.author: Go Fun Toys

customer_reviews.title: USB 3.0 Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed and extremely fast portable digital memory drive. A bit pricy but I'm happy with my purchase. This flash drive smokes the competition in read/write speed.
customer_reviews.author: bear

customer_reviews.title: Tough, reliable and fast
customer_reviews.text: Great little flash drive. Has taken a beating from me and has had no problems. Four instead of five stars since I've encountered a few USB ports that don't supply enough power to run it.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, service and I would recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Lupe

customer_reviews.title: Quality Drive
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and quality feeling super fast thumb drive. This feels hefty in the hand. Slider works very well. Really happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: J. Terry Bailey

customer_reviews.title: USB 3.0 well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I transfer large movies files and it is a joy to see the progress bar fly by on a 4GB file transfer to my Lexar Triton. The slide on it is kinda stiff but this is preferred to it sliding back and forth undesirably. It has gotten really warm after use. Those are the only "cons" that I've encountered. Great Flash Drive!
customer_reviews.author: SoldumaPraia

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA and Fast
customer_reviews.text: First I like this memory stick because it is made in the USA. Second it is fast because it is USB 3.0. Third it is rugged and well built.
customer_reviews.author: The Travel Blogger

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fast!!! Fast!!! Fast!!! this flash card is the best i've ever had, great material easy to use and like i said before FAST!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Best USB I ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing I transfers files supper fast. I used it to transfer large files (4GB+) from my home computer to my work. The speeds are as advertised I tested them on my computers who both have SSDs and USB 3, and the transfers speeds were around the 110MB writes and 145MB reads. I would recommend this to people who handle large files.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Cheap storage
customer_reviews.text: I loaded it with songs and use it in my car. I love it. Easy to use and lookd good too.
customer_reviews.author: Warren.     you all

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: Although the read speeds are lower than some other flash drives on the market, the write speeds are blistering fast. Overall amazing build quality and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sherman

customer_reviews.title: grandson gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Grandson in his first year of college. He really finds it plus in his work and play.
customer_reviews.author: gypsy70

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a flash drive that suit my needs - this is it. Was the deal of the day and I am glad I got one.
customer_reviews.author: DWINK

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent USB drive , it works like a charm , 100+ Mb/s copy in conjunction with a USB 3.0 port
customer_reviews.author: Bogdan

customer_reviews.title: Lexar JumpDrive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for travel. I like its large capacity for the dumping and storing large quantities of digital pictures.
customer_reviews.author: deejay

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Sleek, and Lightning Fast
customer_reviews.text: First off, this flash drive is fast! The aluminum case not only looks sleek it makes it feel solid. With USB 3.0 I've seen sequential speeds consistently around 160 MB/s read and 110 MB/s write. The best thing is that I don't have to worry about it breaking when I throw it in a backpack or my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Fast
customer_reviews.text: Although this drive is almost twice as expensive as similar USB 3.0 drives, it is twice as fast. The drive feels solid, and has performed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product - Lexar JumpDrive Triton 32GB
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of 32GB, one in november 2012 and the other in may 2013. They are fast, very fast. I've been using them for everyday use like a hard disk and are very reliable. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Florentino González

customer_reviews.title: Very fast drive
customer_reviews.text: AS far as USB drives go most are very slow read and write speeds. This is about four times as fast in a usb3.0 then most drives out there.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Blazinf fast data transfer! Get one! USB 3.0 Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Great drive! Fast as lightning! Buy yourself one - you'll be glad ya' did! I only wish I'd bought the 64Gb while I was at it...
customer_reviews.author: belle de sud

customer_reviews.title: Lexar 32GB
customer_reviews.text: The 3.0 is extremely fast at transfering data, if i were to put 20GB of data on a USB 2.0 flash drive it would take 5-6 hrs. With the USB 3.0 it took about 10 minutes. the price is well worth the time you save. The product is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly fast
customer_reviews.text: Very Fast. Better and more reliable than ant Lacie I've owned. Excellent quality. I highly recommend it. Order one now.
customer_reviews.author: Ammmmiiiinnnn

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I would pay triple the price for this flash drive. It is fast, sleek, and looks great with my MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Amalfitano

customer_reviews.title: shockingly fast
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations, nice solid feel. I love the retractable mechanism and the overall performance of the product. Wanted to buy 64gb drive but it was too expensive for me atm.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Welch

customer_reviews.title: FAST
customer_reviews.text: This "thumbdrive" is easily the fastest write/read speed in the office! Everyone asks to use mine when sharing lare files.
customer_reviews.author: BrianD

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of space and fast data transfers, great for movies on the go and works with samsung blu ray player
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Head

customer_reviews.title: Simply Fast
customer_reviews.text: Pro: - Fast - Smaller than Corsair Voyagers I was using - Retractable Con: - A little slick but whatever Other: Using Crystal Disk Mark I did a test on a sequential read on at 4000mb and it Read@162mb/Write@148mb! For $60 this is a great deal in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: MDK210

customer_reviews.title: Superb - don't even hesitate!
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb device, rigid, sturdy and very elegant design. The transfer speeds are phenominal, both read and write. Very very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ardy

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to be gained on USB 2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed additional capacity, and was also looking for additional write speed. It is faster on a USB 3.0 connection (as expected), but I don't think I'm seeing any improvement when I connect to USB 2.0 connections. Unfortunately, only one of the three computers I use have USB 3.0 capability.
customer_reviews.author: tquinn

customer_reviews.title: Used item
customer_reviews.text: 6/5/2013 The drive seems to work fine. But it has been used before. It had over a gig of files on it. I posted Amazon am waiting a reply. I can't tell how fast it is but it seems to be faster than my usb 2.0 drives. Will keep updating as I fined out more.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. Excellent built quality - feels solid in your hand. The data transfer speeds reached 170MB/S for read and 145MB/S for write on my USB3 which is among the fastest.
customer_reviews.author: Strategist

customer_reviews.title: Lexmark 64 gb
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy to use. Not like the sandisk which I returned. I would definitely recommend this product. It was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jmatosny

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Even in a 2.0 USB port it's fast and now I don't have to worry about my data taking too long to load!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Rein

customer_reviews.title: Fast... but not as fast as the much cheaper Corsair Flash Voyager GT
customer_reviews.text: I had a 64 GB Corsair Flash Voyager GT for over a year. It went belly up (some sort of connection problem) so I looked for a replacement. The Lexar is touted to be of top speed and quality, but substantially more expensive. I decided to pay for quality and bought it. It is well made. But its noticably slower that the Corsair I owned before. After repeated uses, the typical average copy speed (as reported by Teracopy) is 55MB/sec with the Lexar. The much cheaper Corsair averaged in the 70's.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang For Your Buck when it Comes to USB 3.0 Flash Drives IMO
customer_reviews.text: Just got this thumbstick so I can't fully review it thoroughly yet. However, I can say that it is fast, VERY FAST! Also, at the time of this review it is a great deal at only 90 bucks for a 32 GB drive that performs at these speeds. I'll post the first benchmark I ran with Crystal Disk Mark to prove the speeds I'm getting when connected to my Dell XPS 15z laptop running Windows 7 x64 at USB 3.0 speeds.
customer_reviews.author: J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not good with movies or raw pictures.
customer_reviews.text: My files became currupted after placing RAW images and .mov files on the drive. Reformatting the drive did not help. It might be a defected drive but this is my objective experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bitsicas

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: Well designed and built product, noticeably faster than other flash drives. Unfortunately, it has a serious problem which reduces it's usefulness. If the drive is plugged into my computer it will not boot, it freezes at the first splash screen. It appears that the BIOS is unable to read it so it freezes when it tries to boot. This might be a problem with the BIOS but I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Not Mac friendly
customer_reviews.text: This product reviewed very well online. It had all the positives going for it. I loved the Made in USA. Solid product for sure. It does everything it says it does. With one thing missing. IT's not mac friendly. I have a macbook air and i was getting 2.0 results not 3.0 so i returned it. Look on the Lexar website and you'll see that they agree it still needs work.
customer_reviews.author: kev haleblian

customer_reviews.title: Still perfect
customer_reviews.text: I can remember when I got this, maybe 10 years ago. But it is easily still my favorite and fastest flash drive in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy cohrs

customer_reviews.title: Extreme speed and performance
customer_reviews.text: This is super-fast drive! It's as fast as my 3.0 WD for Mac. The material and build quality is unsurpassed. I think it can outlast any break and tear. It's a retractable drive which is great since you don't lose any caps or have any dongling items.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast
customer_reviews.text: Used this to transfer XDCAM-EX files using USB-3 and it was very fast. It is as most other people said a bit large and does not allow other USB inputs next to it when connected due to it's extra width but that is a small price to pay for its speed.
customer_reviews.author: TV Guy

product_meta.title: Lexar JumpDrive Triton 64GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive LJDNV64GCRBNA
product_meta.description:
One of the fastest USB 3.0 flash drives available, the ultra-portable Lexar JumpDrive Triton USB 3.0 flash drive leverages SuperSpeed USB 3.0 technology for blazing-fast file transfer, with write speeds up to 150MB/s (more than 20x faster than standard drives). This gives you the power, for example, to quickly and easily transfer 100 songs in less than 20 seconds and a full-length HD movie in less than 40 seconds.** Beyond its powerful capabilities, the drive has a sleek design with a metal alloy base and high-gloss mirror finish top that you’ll want to show off wherever you go. Limited lifetime warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Jump Drive Triton 

PREMIUM, SUPERSPEED USB 3.0 FLASH DRIVE
One of the fastest USB flash drives available, the Lexar® JumpDrive® Triton USB 3.0 flash drive leverages SuperSpeed USB 3.0 technology to deliver blazing-fast transfer speeds, with write speeds up to 150MB/s.* The drive is ultra portable for everyday use and boasts a sleek metal alloy design. Lexar JumpDrive Triton is available in 16GB, 32GB, and 64GB capacities.

SLEEK, HIGH-PERFORMANCE PORTABLE STORAGE
Among the Fastest USB Flash Drives Available. The Lexar Triton USB 3.0 flash drive leverages SuperSpeed USB 3.0 technology to provide blazing-fast file transfer, with up to 155MB/s read and 150MB/s write (more than 20x faster than standard drives). This gives you the power, for example, to quickly and easily transfer 100 songs in less than 20 seconds and a full-length HD movie in less than 40 seconds.**

Sleek Metal Alloy Design. Beyond its powerful capabilities, the drive has a sleek design with a metal alloy base and high-gloss mirror finish top that you’ll want to show off wherever you go. What’s more, its retractable connector with convenient thumb slide makes it so easy to use, you can do it with one hand. With its premium look and feel, JumpDrive Triton is an excellent solution for those looking for a durable and well-designed USB 3.0 flash drive.

Ultra Portable Size for Everyday Use. The ultra-portable JumpDrive Triton is sized for convenience. This easily-accessible portable storage solution provides both high-speed performance and high-capacity options, so you can quickly store and transfer large libraries of multimedia content and a vast number of files. And with its convenient size, it fits nicely in your pocket for life on the go.

Lexar Performance, Quality, Compatibility, and Reliability. All Lexar memory card, card reader, and USB flash drive product designs undergo extensive testing in the Lexar Quality Labs, facilities with more than 800 digital devices, to ensure performance, quality, compatibility, and reliability. This provides customers with a high level of confidence when using Lexar products to capture, manage, move, and store the memories that matter.

Lexar offers a comprehensive line of innovative, award-winning memory products in several categories, including memory cards, card readers, USB flash drives, and portable backup drives. With so many options, it’s easy to find the right Lexar solution to fit your needs.

LEXAR. WHEN MEMORY MATTERS.™
*Speeds based on internal testing. Actual performance may vary. **Based on 32GB and 64GB capacities. 128kbps MP3 audio. HD 1080p@30fps video. Actual usable memory capacity may vary. 1GB equals 1 billion bytes.

Sleek design with metal alloy base and high-gloss mirror finish top
View larger image PRODUCT HIGHLIGHTS
 * Among the fastest USB flash drives available—leverages SuperSpeed USB 3.0 technology for blazing-fast file transfer, up to 155MB/s read and 150MB/s write* 
 * Sleek design with metal alloy base and high-gloss mirror finish top
 * Ultra portable for everyday use
 * Reliably stores and transfers files,photos, videos, and more
 * Compatible with PC and Mac® systems
 * Limited lifetime warranty

CAPACITIES
 * 16GB (up to 145MB/s read, 110MB/s write)
 * 32GB (up to 155MB/s read, 150MB/s write)
 * 64GB (up to 155MB/s read, 150MB/s write)

Amazon.com Return Policy:You may return any new computer purchased from Amazon.com that is "dead on arrival," arrives in damaged condition, or is still in unopened boxes, for a full refund within 30 days of purchase. Amazon.com reserves the right to test "dead on arrival" returns and impose a customer fee equal to 15 percent of the product sales price if the customer misrepresents the condition of the product. Any returned computer that is damaged through customer misuse, is missing parts, or is in unsellable condition due to customer tampering will result in the customer being charged a higher restocking fee based on the condition of the product. Amazon.com will not accept returns of any desktop or notebook computer more than 30 days after you receive the shipment. New, used, and refurbished products purchased from Marketplace vendors are subject to the returns policy of the individual vendor.VIDEOS

CUSTOMER REVIEWS
3.8 out of 5 stars3.8 out of 5140 customer ratings 5 star 51% 4 star 13% 3 star 12% 2 star 11% 1 star 14% How are ratings calculated?To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzes reviews to verify trustworthiness. 





CUSTOMER IMAGES
See all customer images Top reviews Most recent Top reviews THERE WAS A PROBLEM FILTERING REVIEWS RIGHT NOW. PLEASE TRY AGAIN LATER.
Skyrocket4.0 out of 5 stars The FASTEST USB 3.0 on Amazon - Super quick and solidly builtReviewed in the United States on May 9, 2013Verified Purchase I was in the market for a USB 3.0 thumb drive. What I quickly found out is that all thumb drives are NOT created equal. After reading around I was zeroing in on three drives. What made me choose the Lexar was the read / write comparisons found here: [...] (Amazon - This link is very helpful for people in the market, please do not remove)

When the Lexar arrived, I was very pleased!

Pros:
* Really Really FAST - "Mind blowing fast" on real world file transfers on USB 3.0 both on my 13" MacBook Pro Retina & Alienware X51. Mine scored higher then the test shown on cnet and WhoRatesIt
* Great build quality - Aluminum back, solid retractable switch and I love how they turn the arrow into a read / write LED. Feels well built in your hand
* Mae in the USA - I was amazed when I saw that this was made in the US; said it right on the case.

Cons:
* Size (Width & Height) - This item is wide and tall. If you have a Uni-body Aluminium MacBook Pro where the two USB are side by side, you will have an issue using the second port. You might have a clearance issue on an Ultrabook.

When I started my search I was really looking for a tiny USB flash drive like the SanDisk Cruzer Fit with USB 3.0. Unfortunately there does not seem to be any small USB 3.0 drives on the market that hit these speeds.Read more 2 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Russel5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Speeds!Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2018Verified Purchase I bought this USB drive back in 2012 for around $120. It's almost 2019 now, and it's still the best USB drive I've owned. I finally got around to running a speed test (after all these years) and was surprised that it actually had read/write speeds that were the same! ~179/175 MB/s!!! Of course, you get what you pay for, it's not cheap by any means. The performance is amazing, and the construction is solid and sturdy. I've used this drive to transfer anything from large work folders, my movies, my library of music, for the past 6 years, and it's never let me down or failed on me.Read more Helpful Comment Report abuse Jeremy S5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Flash DriveReviewed in the United States on August 29, 2012Verified Purchase As more and more of my computers start supporting USB 3.0 I felt it was time to replace my smaller USB 2.0 Flash drives with a single larger, faster one. I put of getting one to see what Sandisk would release but I balked and the prices Sandisk wanted for their drives. Instead, based on its reviews I chose this one. After receiving it I ran a few performance tests on both USB 2.0 ports and USB 3.0 ports. All testing was done using Crystal Disk Mark with 5 runs of 1000MB each

USB 2.0 Ports
Sandisk Cruzer 8GB (My older usb 2.0 drive)
Read 19.45 MB/s
Write 4.75 MB/s

Lexar JumbDrive Triton
Read 34.81 MB/s
Write 30.50 MB/s

As you can tell this drive offers a significant improvement even on computers without USB 3.0 ports.

USB 3.0 Ports
Lexar JumbDrive Triton
Read 179.3 MB/s
Write 151.2 MB/s

It was a bit shocking how fast files transferred over USB 3.0 after being so used to slow drives and slow ports.

Pros:
+ Excellent speeds
+ Attractive appearance
+ Good solid feel

Cons:
- Price?

Yes, this drive is more expensive per GB that others you can find but in this case I think that the adage "You get what you pay for" really does hold true.Read more Helpful Comment Report abuse Freddy The Frog TOP 1000 REVIEWER 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast, Fierce, Flawless... solid buildReviewed in the United States on August 15, 2012Verified Purchase I carry jump drives often for presentations and also for transferring large files (often more than 28 gigs) from one computer to another.

As my studio computers all have the blue-USB 3 connections, it only makes sense to fully exploit that capability with the fastest jump drive available.

Example... transferring a 28 gig file batch was taking circa 26 minutes to load with USB-2, Using this Lexar USB 3.0, that time was under 6 minutes...

Ever go to give a presentation with all of your excellent work on a jump drive and then having to stand around making small talk while it loads on someone elses system?
If they have USB 3.0 capability and you have this jump drive, it's a load-and-go experience with video and transitions flowing seemlessly to the screen without hesitation.

Even though this jumpdrive is rated at a 32 GB capacity, I can't load a full 31 GB file (not enough space)... so, I'm back today, ordering the largest version they offer.

If work flow is important and you often work under time constraints as I do... this is really the only choice for solid construction, plug and play capability and blinding fast speeds.
Other presentors will stand around suffering from JumpDrive Envy as they witness the performance of this tiny miracle.

I use it to transfer files from one computer to another for image editing and temporary storage of large files.

There isn't anything quicker you can buy, so I say go with this one if quality and speed are your top priority.

The markings on the drive are white against a shiny black background... can read the size of the drive clearly even in low light situations so you know you have the correct size (if you carry several)...

If you routinely give power point presentations in HD or need to stream Multi-Media with the convenience of pocket carry, this is it. Get One and have time for coffee....Read more Helpful Comment Report abuse Matthew T.5.0 out of 5 stars fast as lightning, worth it if you can still find oneReviewed in the United States on June 7, 2014Verified Purchase Had one of these in 16GB size for years, managed to find this 32GB still new in box and jumped on it. The 32GB size is in itself nothing special. What is special about this drive aside from it being USB 3.0 is the fact that Lexar used SLC flash chips in the Triton series. Most other USB flash drives offered today use MLC or TLC flash chips, which allow higher capacities but are slower and wear out sooner than SLC chips do. So when you see this Triton drive in 32GB at nearly the same asking price as some other 64GB drive, that is because the 64GB drive is using the lower grade MLC or TCL chips. SLC chips have, on average, a 10x longer lifespan than MLC chips. You're paying more because this drive will last longer.Read more One person found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse See all reviews from the United States TOP INTERNATIONAL REVIEWS 
Homer5.0 out of 5 stars Blindingly fastReviewed in the United Kingdom on October 12, 2012Verified Purchase Speed tests are highly dependent upon the chipset, but on my AMD Fusion-based USB3 ports I achieved 95MB/s, which is way off the claimed 155MB/s, but still extremely fast compared to my other flash drives, most of which top out at around 8MB/s. YMMV.

Definitely recommended.Read more Helpful Sending feedback...Thank you for your feedback.Sorry, we failed to record your vote. Please try again Report abuse Peter5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable Flash drive with SLC NAND FlashReviewed in Canada on April 16, 2015Verified Purchase This is fast and very solid USB flash drive, it works wonderful and the best of all this flash drive has inside SLC NAND Flash made by Micron and Innostor controller which mean reliability and durability is not an issue, hence the price tag for this particular model. I am very happy with it, too bad SLC NAND Flash is used less and less in favor of TLC NAND Flash.Read more Helpful Sending feedback...Thank you for your feedback.Sorry, we failed to record your vote. Please try again Report abuse YOU'VE READ THE TOP INTERNATIONAL REVIEWS
